ai.question: Which devices can be connected to a VLAN trunk? (Choose three.)

choice.text: a switch
a hub
a router
a server with a special NIC
a CSU/DSU
a repeater

ai.question: What happens when there is a topology change on a network that utilizes STP ? (Choose two.)

choice.text: User traffic is disrupted until recalculation is complete.
The switch recomputes the Spanning Tree topology after the network converges.
All ports are placed in learning state until convergence has occurred.
A delay of up to 50 seconds is incurred for convergence of the new Spanning Tree topology.
User data is forwarded while BPDUs are exchanged to recompute the topology.

ai.question: Refer to the exhibit. Which set of commands should be used to configure the router to provide communication between the two hosts connected to the switch?

choice.text:
R_1(config)# interface vlan 30
R_1(config-if)# switchport mode trunk dot1q
R_1(config-if)# interface vlan 40
R_1(config-if)# switchport mode trunk dot1q

R_1(config)# interface fastethernet 0/0
R_1(config-if)# mode trunk dot1q 30 40
R_1(config-if)# ip address 192.168.1.1 255.255.255.0

R_1(config)# interface vlan 30
R_1(config-if)# ip address 192.168.30.1 255.255.255.0
R_1(config-if)# no shutdown
R_1(config-if)# interface vlan 40
R_1(config-if)# ip address 192.168.40.1 255.255.255.0
R_1(config-if)# no shutdown

R_1(config)# interface fastethernet 0/0
R_1(config-if)# no shutdown
R_1(config-if)# interface fastethernet 0/0.3
R_1(config-if)# encapsulation dot1q 30
R_1(config-if)# ip address 192.168.30.1 255.255.255.0
R_1(config-if)# interface fastethernet 0/0.4
R_1(config-if)# encapsulation dot1q 40
R_1(config-if)# ip address 192.168.40.1 255.255.255.0

ai.question: How do a Layer 3 switches differ from traditional routers?

choice.text: Layer 3 switches are used in LANs, while routers are used in WANs.
Layer 3 switches use ASICS for routing, while routers are software based.
Layer 3 switches never perform routing lookups, while routers must always perform them.
Layer 3 switches forward packets based on MAC address only, while routers use IP addresses for forwarding.

ai.question: Which two problems are caused by redundant links in a switched network? (Choose two.)

choice.text: routing table corruption
switching loops
broadcast storms
routing loops
corrupt forwarding information base

ai.question: Refer to the exhibit. The switches in the diagram are interconnected by trunked links and are configured with the VTP modes shown. A new VLAN is added to Switch1. Which three actions will occur? (Choose three.)

choice.text: Switch1 will not add the VLAN to its VLAN database and will pass the update to Switch2.
Switch3 will pass the VTP update to Switch4.
Switch3 will add the VLAN to its VLAN database.
Switch4 will add the VLAN to its VLAN database.
Switch4 will not receive the update.
Switch2 will add the VLAN to its VLAN database and pass the update to Switch3.

ai.question: What two criteria does STP use to elect the root bridge in a redundantly switched network? (Choose two.)

choice.text: amount of switch RAM
bridge priority
switching speed
number of switch ports
switch MAC address
switch location

ai.question: Following a link failure, when does RSTP allow ports to move to the forwarding state?

choice.text: in less than a second
in two seconds
in 30 seconds
in 50 seconds
in 90 seconds

ai.question: In what two ways does the use of VLANs benefit an organization? (Choose two.)

choice.text: by centralizing departmental staff and network resources together in a single physical area
by allowing organizational flexibility by grouping users together by function instead of physical location
by allowing logical separation of voice and other critical traffic from the rest of the data traffic
by reducing the number of broadcast domains in an enterprise network
by reducing network management costs by replacing many Layer 2 devices with a few Layer 3 devices
by eliminating the need for routing traffic in large networks

ai.question: Refer to the exhibit. Access1 is a new switch that is to be connected as a VTP client to the network once it has been configured. Given the output generated by the VTP server switch Dist-2, which series of configuration commands would successfully introduce the client switch into the VTP domain?

choice.text:
Access1(config)# vtp mode client
Access1(config)# vtp domain mycorp
Access1(config)# vtp password ITrustYou

Access1(config)# vtp mode client
Access1(config)# vtp domain MYCORP
Access1(config)# vtp version 2
Access1(config)# vtp password ITrustYou

Access1(config)# vtp mode client
Access1(config)# vtp domain mycorp
Access1(config)# vtp password ITrustYou

Access1(config)# vtp mode client
Access1(config)# vtp domain Mycorp
Access1(config)# vtp version 2
Access1(config)# vtp password ITrustYou

ai.question: What elements will exist in a converged switched network running spanning tree? (Choose two.)

choice.text: one root bridge per network
all non-designated ports forwarding
one root port per non-root bridge
multiple designated ports per segment
one designated port per network

ai.question: How often are spanning-tree BPDUs sent by default?

choice.text: every second
every two seconds
every three seconds
every four seconds

ai.question: Refer to the exhibit. A router is configured to connect to a trunked uplink as shown. A packet is received on the FastEthernet 0/1 physical interface from VLAN 1. The packet destination address is 192.168.1.85. What will the router do with this packet?

choice.text: The router will ignore the packet because the source and destination are on the same broadcast domain.
The router will forward the packet out interface FastEthernet 0/1.1.
The router will forward the packet out interface FastEthernet 0/1.2.
The router will forward the packet out interface FastEthernet 0/1.3.
The router will drop the packet because no network that includes the destination address is attached to the router.
